New York City
The Boroughs
Manhattan
Manhattan

  • The center of the city.


  • The borough with the highest population density


  • Manhattan has a whopping GDP of over 600 Billion Dollars
Brooklyn
Brooklyn

  • The borough with the largest population.


  • Over 30 miles of beach.


  • Originally settled by the Dutch and spelled Brueklyn
Staten Island
Staten Island

  • Staten Island has the highest median household income.


  • Has 170 parks and is know as the "borough of parks".


  • Unsuccsessfully voted to succeed from NYC in 1993.
Queens
Queens

  • The largest borough by land area.


  • The most ethnically diverse borough.


  • Home to 2 of the 3 NYC airports
The Bronx
The Bronx

  • Named after Jonas Bronk.


  • Only borough that is located on the mainland US.


  • Experienced a population boom from 1900 to 1930, going from 100,000 to 1.3 million people.
